intro: Borreria herzogii, commonly known as the Mexican bluebrush, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with woody stems and narrow, leathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Borreria herzogii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
